lead_paragraph: J. J. Redick pleaded guilty yesterday in Durham, N.C., to drunken-driving charges and received one year of probation. Redick, a former Duke star and the first-round draft pick of the Orlando Magic, also had his license suspended for 60 days, was ordered to pay $410 in fees and court costs, and must perform 24 hours of community service, according to the district attorney’s office.
